usgfZbmftzSQO9DY6poELQ.text: YES! As an American visiting London, this was such a delicious experience. Our darling server was from Poland was was absolutely lovely. We got the (not) porn star martinis - yummy! - but very sweet and could only drink one. Next up, i got the lobster roll and it was just as good as any lobster roll I've ever had, if not better. The spicy burger was great, as well! The portions are large (sandwich, fries, and a salad). Was thrilled to hear they have locations in NYC!

MT9xkCHT5R3E-m5T9bcvdg.text: Read about B & L on Yelp. Figured we'd give it a go. In a word: Wow! Great atmosphere (warm, casual, efficient) and terrific food. My husband had the burger and lobster combo while I chose the lobster burger (beef cooked to  order, with lobster piled on it). Sublime. Pricey: dinner for two just shy of $100 (3 beers). Plenty of locals and visitors, alike. All treated like an old friend. Highly recommend.

Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

7byzDXyMrNIqRUxWKfFWgg.text: This is a place I bookmarked before going to London too.  The first night we arrived in London, we came to this place for dinner and the place was pack.  Make reservations if you want to come!  We waited a little over 30 mins for a table.  They give you a choice to put your name and number down and they will call when your table is ready.. or you can just wait there.  Since the beau and I both don't drink, we decided to waited there.There are only 3 items on the menu... burger, lobster (grilled or boiled), or lobster roll all for the price of 20 pounds each.  We both ordered the lobster roll. The dish came with fries and a salad.  Yummy.  I love the bun the lobster roll came in and the fries were also delicious! I would have to say that this is the most delicious meal we had in London.  Its a bit on the pricier side...but everything in London is expensive.  Our total came up to 43 pounds and after the conversion, the total came up to $70 USD.  If you are in London, you have to try this place out!

F3K339Yr9q4p0_KCG5lPig.text: first time at burger & lobster. Pricer than expected (lobster roll was £25, 2 lb lobster was £40) but the food is excellent. Casual, hip setting. Deducting 1 star for the price to food worth.

fApBhTpQdTRBouW7UJEIyQ.text: Ate at Burger and Lobster while in London a short bit ago. Amazing burger creations. Food was great and the only problem with the place is it's tough to decide what to get out of unique selections. Ended up going here after just being out and about for the day taking in some of the typical tourist sites. Glad I made the slight detour after seeing the photos and reviews on Yelp for it. The place was crowded when I arrived (late lunch on a Friday), but was able to get a seat at the bar quickly. Service was attentive and everyone in the place seemed to be enjoying themselves. Great atmosphere and great food. Highly recommend it if you get the chance to stop in for a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster burger with chips. Burger might not look that "big" round wise, but it was a thick burger.

PR1aFwdo6IjJez6ip49i5g.text: It reminds me Red Lobster but definitely with an higher quality. Living in NY and eating an hamburger from Nebraska and a lobster from Canada is not what I would experience in London, but my girlfriend asked for and I have no regret. The lobster was nicely cooked, the hamburger tasty and the service quick. The place was very crowded and the atmosphere nice. It definitely doesn't come at a cheap price but it's reasonable for this kind of restaurants.

LHV48ylL7wvnpq9ZjYHEQA.text: This is a chain that offered, well, burgers and lobsters.  The choices were few and the meals fulfilling, satisfying, enjoyable, and messy.  I only wished their beer selection was bigger.  Don't be fooled by the cheap deco, the bill is not.There is really only one kind of burger and it's way over-priced.  I recommend coming here really for lobster only.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Combo lobster.  This is the one to order.

tZypnR5T8x-bqI8UwR2t_w.text: Ordered "The Beast". Consists of a 10 oz patty imported from the US and lobster. Great tasting and finished the whole thing. Suggest using the place mat to tame this beast as it is over 4 1/2" thick.  It cheap eats, but trendy and a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

TNb0zC0T9QEZX6JuyimkBw.text: Burger & Lobster started in London and my cousin raved about it so we stopped in for a meal. There are multiple locations but we ended up at this one, which was near Buckingham Palace. We were lucky to be there during the national lobster day, which means that if we buy a whole giant lobster, we get a free bottle of prosecco and unlimited sides of salad and fries.The 1.7kg lobster ran me 85 British pounds. It was indeed huge and the quality was amazing. We got half grilled and half boiled lobster. The lobster comes with unlimited garlic butter sauce. The lobster was fresh and the flesh was very firm and sweet. Between the 2 types of cooking method, I definitely preferred the boiled but both were delicious.The service here is alright. Everyone is super nice but it's extremely busy so it's hard to get somebody's attention at times. I recommend arriving around opening time to minimize the wait time as the wait can get really long.

3fhDOxgnMnry04BhDRpYBg.text: Nice place to have burger. The food is delicious and not too pricey. Little busy sometimes but enjoyed it

IZcHR6MOfMu8dcOGvp3d5w.text: First meal in London! There are a number of locations in London, but this one was a super convenient 6-minute walk from our hotel. We opted to sit at the bar to avoid the 15 minute wait for a table. Our first task was ordering cocktails. I chose the BL Burger Bellini (£9), which had strawberry, hibiscus, lemon, and fizz. A lovely drink even in the dead of early winter. My BF got the B&L does Gin & tonic (£9), a twist on a classic gin and tonic with peach, grapefruit, and cucumber tonic. We decided to get the B&L combo, which is a 1.26 lb lobster and a 5 oz burger for £36. If you're going to come to Burger & Lobster, how can you not order the two quintessential menu items that this restaurant specializes in? We chose the lobster to be grilled. It's also served with a salad and chips (French fries for us Americans). Both the burger and the lobster were phenomenal. Cooked to perfection, oozing with juices and melted butter. It was like a symphony exploded into song in my mouth. So mouth-wateringly delicious. Chatting a bit with our server/bartender, we found out that this is actually a small global chain. There are even a couple of locations in NYC. They get their beef from a farm in Nebraska, and the lobster is sourced from Nova Scotia. Excellent food and great service. We will have to try the ones in NYC next!

CPLrrthar7vEiPOt52Klhw.text: Amazing amazing lobster! Flown in weekly from Maine. Was really fresh! And the garlic butter with chives - omg I've never had any sauce this tasty before! The fries were perfect! Even the salad was good, and I'm not usually a big salad fan. Fresh greens, great balsamic dressing, tangy and slightly sweet. Sat at the bar, and the service was friendly and attentive but not overbearing. Will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

_42cGNFDGtlGcmlr1R-tfQ.text: Yum!! The place was packed so do make reservations. Our server was fun and friendly. We had hors d'oeuvres at our hotel, so asked if we could split the burger and lobster combo. Not only was that okay, but when we hesitated over steamed versus grilled lobster, our waitress said she could do half and half! So we were served half a grilled lobster, half a steamed lobster, an amazingly delicious burger, and fries and a salad. I can't wait to go to NYC to visit my daughter and try out the Burgers and Lobster there!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Just HALF of the combo plate.

cGBCOzdXInWifF9G4gFMhA.text: Located at the top floor of Harvey Nichols, this is a great place to grab some lunch while shopping here or in the area. Burger and Lobster is a chain that started in 2011 with 4 schoolmates on a rooftop in London wanted to create a place that specialized in 1-2 main ingredients. In a small Irish Pub in Mayfair is where the first Burger and Lobster was started. Now it has expanded to many locations worldwide. London has 9 locations. The menu is simple: 1. Starter -Croquette, calamari, prawn, or dip. 2. Pick a main course (comes with chips and salad)       Lobster (1 lb vs. 1.5 lb vs. Chili)        Roll - Singapore or Original        Burger - Original, California, or Lobster        Combo (5 oz Burger and 1 lb. Lobster )  3. Dessert- Cheesecake, brownie, or Sundae. *Get a cocktail- they are quiet good. The quality of the food is excellent, especially for a chain restaurant. Simple and delicious. Also, big portions. Ricky had to help me finish my meal.  Recommend for a solid lunch option.

OmicVOv_Q0kH0UjN7rUdxQ.text: Brilliant food. I ordered a combo set with beef burger and lobster. The burger is big and delicious. Lobster tastes well too. Two people cost 87 pounds. We will come here next time.

Yini3tFRPEb3GFbjYN_prw.text: Great lobster! Friendly staff! Please order the croquettes! You won't be disappointed.

FIIYz9BE4_DwPqqid5CdbQ.text: Came here for the first time as a treat for my birthday, burgers and lobsters are two of my favourite food items, and it really didn't disappoint! The staff were friendly and didn't mind me asking for amendments.

aQ7XmvpGpWVqNe0bVeljXw.text: You get just what the name says...burgers or lobster. Both are delicious. I could see why a local London friend recommended. The limited menu keeps the food moving swiftly, the ingredients are simple and high quality. The restaurant is boisterous and the bar was active when I was there. I'd definitely return.

Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

HuJKSo66896uEoxfl6qBCQ.text: We came to London for 5 days/4 nights, and we ate here THREE TIMES. Probably not the most touristy thing to do (like, why didn't we try more restaurants?!) but it was SO GOOD we just couldn't help it!We ended up there our first night in London because it had good reviews and was within walking distance of The Ritz, where we stayed. We sat at the bar because it was 5pm & convenient, but then learned that was the easiest place to get in for dinner. (There were lines out the door for tables the other two times we came in. Pro tip: get there before 5 to beat the work crowd; have a drink or two at the bar and then order dinner.)The first time, I ordered a lobster roll; the second time I had a burger (just to try it--DELICIOUS); and then I the last time I had another lobster roll. For me, I would probably go for the lobster roll because that's a little harder to get than a good cheeseburger where I live. BUT, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, really.I wish I remembered our bartender's name from the first night; he made THE BEST old fashioneds and whiskey sours. The other ones we had weren't bad, but the first guy really finessed the drinks, and we could tell.UGH, my mouth is watering just thinking about this place...

s6CpgAO2kg-20y58EYf-QQ.text: Burgers or Lobster that's it! Can't decide...get both! Came here for lunch while visiting London and  honestly there isn't much I can add that hasn't already been said in all the other Yelp reviews except beware of the sneaky service charge. I didn't mind because the food and service is great! I ordered the lobster roll since that's what the fuss seems to be all about.  My lobster was fresh and dressed well. The chips (fries) and salad that comes with it was also delicious. I sat at the bar and the service was attentive and prompt.  This place comes off as upscale because of the decor and price tag however the simplicity of the menu allows for a laid back and casual dining experience. It really is a kick back and enjoy yourself type vibe.

gUtxh8Y4mp4HB7HUuYtvBw.text: I would give 1 star since the only thing I showed for wasn't available as the grill was down AND the service was surly upon our arrival at 20 minutes before but we walked around the blocks and get to hang out a decent coffee shop while people watching.I didn't notice this, even with the signage in the bathroom translated in a number of languages, the bestie picked up on this spot was heavily patronized by Asians. Nothing good nor bad - just a point of information. I'm used to it for crawfish in LA and even GA - they deep but I wonder if they have any complaints about the seasoning or taste of the seafood. Like the Vietnamese on the Westbank of New Orleans cook their shellfish like a true Louisianian - all spicy and muah. This was priced higher than I anticipated and wouldn't pay for what I had if I had to do it again. People please KNOW: I took a train ride from the airport. Black car to Buckingham. Walked from Buckingham to this location all with backpacks on our backs and couldn't be allowed to sit and wait for 20 minutes until they officially opened. Ok whatever, we waited at a coffee shop found two blocks over, tried to get a massage across the street from the restaurant and was told no one was on duty but they could get me tomorrow....Bestie said it was for men not for me. lolzEither way, returned 10 minutes after opening and the place was packed. Take it for what you need it to be. Again, I'm butt hurt the grill was on the fritz and no one seemed bothered by it all.

lF_tYvWuDnfkj7ItMLdssg.text: Everything here is SO good!!! If you like lobster, you NEED to come to this place. Come and get a whole one pound lobster for less than 25 pounds! They also have an amazing lobster roll and omg their lobster burger is so good! All the things I love in this world were all packed in one burger - JUICY meat patty + flavorful lobster + Brie + truffle! Servers here are amazing too. Come here for great food, fun environment, and great service!!!

fqZ2ugttRnYjX273Uv6Tog.text: Loved this place! A bit pricey but the service was wonderful and the food was delicious. I ordered the 1.75 lb lobster and it was huge and grilled perfectly. My wife got the burger and said it was the best one she had in all of London.

oYKJoFAEtx2Xe2U4NwecDQ.text: Lobster rolls are one of my favourite things, so I was more than happy to finally get to one of these after it being suggested to me. It's a chain, I famously rant about chains and try my best to stick to independents when I'm not with people who insist on ruddy Nando's (ugh!) and although the burgers are a little pricier to match the lobster I presume, the lobster is actually pretty cheap by lobster-y standard, and although I have had some amazing lobster in the past, this wasn't half bad at all. I plumped for the lobster burger, because I also love meat, and Brie and truffle, so all of those packed in with some nicely seasoned chips was pretty good. The staff were lovely, and I would rack this up as one of the less offensive chains.

HXsx41YVonUeZKh-ZytmeQ.text: The year was 1992. Lieutenant Colonel Frank Slade (Al Pacino) takes Charlie Simms out to dinner to an upscale restaurant in New York (in the movie "Scent of a woman"). The burger cost $24. Who pays so much for a burger and where on earth do you get such expensive burgers ?Fast forward twenty years. The answer is "Burger and Lobster". This joint has been open for barely a couple of months I hear and is already a rage. I first attempted to visit last Thursday for dinner. My friend advised me to get there by six. What ! Anybody has dinner that early ? Enough people actually. When I reached at 6:15, there was already a two hour wait. Thankfully I slipped into the an extra chair with my friend as we converted a table for two to a three. If its a small group (four or less) and you want o be seated immediately, get here by six. If you are part of a larger group, then get here even earlier. They don't take reservations. The menu was limited. It's either burger, or lobster or lobster roll. They all cost the same ... £20. I went for the burger. It comes with cheese and bacon, if you so wish and one portion of chips and salad. You can ask for as many of the sides as you want for no extra cost. B&L have a very streamlined operational process and the food arrived very quickly (even before I got the drink). The burger was very big. The patty was made of tender, delicious meat and excellently cooked. The bacon was not too crisp and not too soggy, just perfect. It was more than enough to fill one person. The burger was great, but was it worth £20. I still wasn't sure ... and the crowd that we were seeing waiting at the bar ... was the burger the reason for this rage ? Must be the lobster, we decided. So I dropped in for a late lunch (2:15) two days later. It was crowded again, though slightly less so. At lunch they allow smaller groups to sit and order food from the bar, which is what I did ... The full lobster this time ... With molten lemon and garlic butter. The lobster was served steamed and cut open (they do provide a plier for the show). It was just divine. I was able to access parts of the animal which I have never been able to taste before (since its usually so difficult to handle). The meat was easy to scoop out and lobster to me has rarely tasted better. B&L won a promotion to 5 stars from 4 in my eyes. The chips here are not the very best (i.e, not as good as the ones at Hawksmoor), but pretty well done nevertheless. I finished the salad on both occasions ... so there isn't anything left to say about that except that it was good (the dressing was lovely). B&L have their drinks classified as being better with burger or lobster. But i ignored their classification and ordered the Gin fizz on my first visit. It's a cocktail that's not very common even in bar menus, let alone at restaurants. So I was pleasantly surprised to find that they had made it well. The next time I went for the Clarges Buck, a concoction made of Chivas Regal whiskey and several different kinds of fruit juices and syrups. It was tasty. The cocktails were priced at a reasonable £8-£9 range. For desserts you can get either the chocolate mocha mousse or the lemon mousse. I haven't tried them yet. One drink and food ends up costing around £32 here, which isn't very high. Coming here for a 6pm dinner might be difficult but I can foresee several Saturday lunches (they are closed on Sundays) here for me.

rmOIuIROoX60AS7go0PYRA.text: Burger or Lobster?  Which is it and that's it.  This is perfect as I love burgers and this is on the list of places to visit in London. The burgers are big and look amazing but I was let down, the burger bun was some herb/seed induced annoyance which overpowered the meat, which was underwhelming.  Good service, busy, great vibe but ultimately it didn't satisfy me.  Change the bun, simple brioche bun, no herbs, no seeds then I'll come back.

-qUAD3oPZ5vP899TN2qHGw.text: the staff were very friendly and attentive, the wait was about an hour, which in my eyes wasnt really worth it, the food was average, but quite over priced, wouldnt really rate it.

HgJpN3YB3BiwGKboTRKU1Q.text: Good service,i didnt have to wait to be sitted-first time lucky i guess.no menu you get three choices!!so sit back and enjoy it!!!

7HtW3Pe7U_MOn2zbl519VQ.text: Disappointment. Lobster here is super value but was a bit overdone and uninspiring. They really pack in the tables, which is fine if you're after a raucous night out (as everyone else usually is). You'll probably find better burgers and lobsters elsewhere.

CU7YscA6moIFNQ6ocb6iRg.text: The concept itself is great, £20 for a grilled lobster. However the impression that lasts is the service and experience and the manager gave us probably the snootiest and rudest service we have ever experienced. A promise for a table 2 hour later turned out to be 3 hours and "Actually I have no idea when you will get a table". At his advice we waited at the bar and ordered our food so we could get started on our dinner so he decided without checking with us that we were no longer waiting for a table. His wait staff spilled hot butter all over our jacket which was fine as she was so apologetic, but he had no apology or offer to clean the jacket; instead told her off for trying to offer us some chips (afterall we had been waiting for 3 hours).   It was interesting to try but they better clean up their service else it's going downhill very quickly.  Wake up call: the no reservations policy doesn't work for a restaurant serving lobsters where people can take a long time to chew through. Burgers not worth having - go to Goodmans instead, nearly half the price and much better chips. How can the sister restaurant of Goodmans get it so wrong?  So far 8 of our friends have gone on 4 different occasions and we've agreed it's not worth the chaos and rude service.

GuSwiGtgjRUo2zJDy6K6pw.text: The BEST lobster place in London! Have not tried their burgers yet, so next time!!

cQGdHabTcmmyITe3oBWvrg.text: I LOVE Burger and Lobster! This is a very straight forward place. All they serve is well burgers and lobster. When I first heard this I was a little disappointed. Don't let this get you down though. Because they only make 2 things, you better bet those 2 things are cooked to PERFECTION!! I ordered the burger. I have never had a burger that was so juicy and flavorful!! It came on a nice warm bun with delicious grilled onions, lettuce mix, and tomatoes!! Along with that it came with a side of skinny fries (or should I say chips), which were seasoned perfectly! I also believe it came with a small side salad, which amazingly was very delicious as well. My dad ordered the lobster, which was also juicy and melted in your mouth! Not only was the food scrumptious, but the service was pretty fabulous as well. Our server was very attentive and even gave us yanks some suggestions of what to do and see while in London. If you decide to go here I would suggest making a reservation, as this location is small and very popular. If you have to wait it is worth the wait!!

N405Ee1T3L3JI-MTx8XiEg.text: This is definitely the place to come if you want to eat some decent lobster and feel like you've got yourself a bargain! £20 for a whole lobster is excellent value and it was tasty and cooked well! Really enjoyed the lobster.However, if you don't like lobster but are accompanying a friend/family that wants to eat lobster, you'll probably be quite disappointed by the burger that you get for £20. Good lobster, but I think that they should really lower the price of the burger!

6tXtj1rP4Fa3WcXZh4dSxg.text: Last night I found myself heading over to the recently opened Burger & Lobster, to see what the hype and queues were all about. From the team behind Goodman's Steakhouse (supposedly one of the best steaks in London), they've certainly stuck by the rules of keeping things simple. There's no food menu as such, except what has been scrawled on the chalk board, Burger or Lobster. Beef burger, whole lobster, or a lobster roll; all served with fries and salad for £20 a pop. For me, there was only one thing to order, and that was the Lobster. Grilled and served with a side of lemon-garlic butter. But for my friend, a self confessed lobster virgin, as he wasn't a fan of crab nor the idea of extracting his supper from the shells, opted for the Beef burger. With our Prosecco and delicious cocktail of Gin, Cucumber and Chamomile syrup in hand, our waiter swiftly brought out our meals on silver trays. My lobster definitely looked impressive. Taste-wise, the meat was sweet and perfectly grilled with a firm chunky texture. However, the accompanying lemon-garlic butter was lacking the lemon tang or the garlic flavour, and it probably could have done with a bit of salt, and a dash of tabasco sauce. My friends burger just looked OK, and probably not worth the money compared with the whole meaty lobster I had in front of me. I'm pretty sure he would have had food envy! Overall, the atmosphere was buzzy, and service was fairly swift once you get through the door, but I'm sitting on the fence with this, and still working out what the hype is about if I'm honest. Yes, it's definitely good value by London standards, especially for a whole lobster, but for the over-priced burger, the lobster roll (which I didn't see anyone eating and understand it's just the claw), and the slight attitude you get from the hostess at the door holding all the power via a clipboard, I'm not sure it's really worth the 1.5 hour wait?! For full review and pictures, please go to gourmetbelly.wordpress.c…x

8TMw3lbWEAaHhzNp1Ke6fw.text: Top draw place.I'm pretty much a regular here, good food, great price, cool drinks and uber friendly waitresses. The food is served exceptionally quickly, I never feel rushed here. Ever.The main issue is the wait outside. However, the last time I did go I was seated in less than 1 minute. This really must be a record for the place.If you're going in a small group 3-4 people and everyone shows up on time its great, perfect place for couples but not so for a first date!Absolutely love the place!

AM4idfYres0gn6Q6OB-Dxw.text: Pics@Chopstix2Steakniveschopstix2steaknives.blog… London has been cold and dreary lately. With the chilliness in the air, my heart and body started craving for something warm like noodle soup. So it was with anticipation and excitement that I set a date to head to Brixton Village to try Mama Lan with SC. As it turned out, Brixton Village isn't open on a Tuesday night and Khao Sarn was full. I suggested Roti Chai and we ended up back on the tube heading towards central London instead. As we thought about where our hungry tummies were going to eat and where we should come out, we spotted Green Park on the tube line and began to wonder if there was anything around there. I turned to SC and said that I think there is a new place called Burger & Lobster that could be there but I wasn't sure, I only remembered that it was in the west. We looked at each other and thought, should we risk it? or head straight to Roti Chai. We decided to take a risk and hopped off at Green Park. A quick confirmation on google maps revealed that we indeed came out at the right stop and walked that few minutes to our destination. Even for a Tuesday night, the place was packed but we were lucky to get a seat without waiting. Burger & Lobster don't take reservations and do note that if your entire party hasn't arrive, you won't get your table. Burger & Lobster only serves two things, burger and lobster (apologies for the pun!). Have you check out their website? It shows two tables with one having lobster and the other a burger, it was simple yet punchy and hit the mark. SC and I ordered one of each and a bottle of wine. Our order took a while to arrive but our lovely waiter, Rihanna kept us informed of the status which was great. Since it's Christmas time, we were happy to wait while catching up and sipping our wines. Our lovely lobster and burger arrived and we proceeded to wear the bibs provided to us. On the first few bites, the burger stood out more. It was a good piece of meat patty, wonderfully seasoned and delicious. It is after all a Goodman burger as this is their latest opening. We ordered our lobster grilled and it came out with a good bouncy bite to it. As we continued our meal, the freshness of the lobster starts to hit you. I was hoping for the soft sweetness of fresh lobster which was not boldly evident in the first bite, but that might be because I ordered it to be grilled instead of just steamed, I'm not sure. Looks can also be deceiving as we nearly contemplated ordering three dishes instead of two like the table next to us. Thankfully, we did not as there was a whole lot of meat in that one lobster and it took me a good steady concentration of 30 minutes to extract all that juicy meat out. The accompanying garlic butter was fragrant and not overly rich which went well with the lobster. The lobster and burgers are definitely the stars of the dishes with the salad and chips playing a side role. SC and I thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and the place has a great relaxed and informal atmosphere to it. I also have to make a special mention to our lovely waitress, Rihanna who only made our experience so much better. She checks on us regularly to make sure that we were good and even showed us the tanks where the lobsters were kept. This was a tip that I got from the twitter-verse, thank you! The best part of Burger & Lobster is yet to come, both dishes are priced at £20! Decadence without breaking the bank, I love this place already and I can see myself coming back regularly. We need more places like this in London, places that serve delicious food at great value. Much to my surprise, a chat with Rihanna revealed that Burger & Lobster only opened its doors on Saturday so a random change of events and chance led us to dining here in its very first week. To Rihanna, thanks for taking such good care of us, the next time I am back, I am leaving a bigger tip!

mw-jPOu8N1Ilz8HLd0ih3w.text: It would be delightful to start this review saying "Well, I've eaten a lot of lobster in my time and frankly my dear, this is the best".  Sadly I haven't.  I've eaten it twice.  The first time was at Cote for my 25th birthday.  This was the second.  Unfortunately, both times hammered home the fact that I have expensive tastes.  If only I hated it.  If only I hated champagne and caviar.  I really need to get a new job.But here come Burger & Lobster to the rescue, catering to the unwashed masses by offering an entire lobster for £20.  They also offer a burger but who'd choose that?  Quite a few people, apparently, and bizarrely.  I saw several wafting past, and other reviewers have stated that they're delicious.  I'm sure they are, but you can get lovely burgers all over town for less than half the price so why on earth you'd queue for three hours and pay £20 for that, I do not know.It isn't actually as straightforward as "lobster or burger".  There's also a lobster roll, which I presume is aimed at prissy people who don't like getting their fingers dirty.  Foolish, since that's half the fun. If you go for the obvious choice, then you can choose between the 700g lobster for £20, or 900g for £30, or a table-sized beast for £80 that can apparently be shared between four people. We were in fact in a group of four but being possessive types, and knowing it would inspire an out-and-out catfight over the claws, we opted for our own.  You can then have it either steamed and grilled, or just steamed; and plain clarified butter, or butter with garlic and herbs.  I can't imagine any combination would disappoint.  My steamed lobster, with garlic and herb butter, was exquisite, and served with perfectly crunchy fries and a deliciously dressed salad.  Considering it was the smaller of the two individual sizes, I also felt on the pleasant side of too full afterwards, and I didn't even indulge in a pudding.The service was outstanding, both from our charming, friendly waitress and the very funny waiter on the door who had to contend with legions of hungry Londoners desperate to get a place on the all-important list.  Yes, you should get there several hours in advance.  Yes, you will queue regardless.  Yes, there are plenty of pubs around the corner where you can go for a pint or three to pass the time.  And yes, you should definitely do that; the drinks here are overpriced to make up for the relatively inexpensive seafood.  The house wine is £22.  When the cheapest plonk on the menu costs more than a bloody lobster, you know the world's gone mad.

n-S0a6kJWGI3gcLgXWttag.text: I've been to this location twice and the lobster and chips have been consistently good.    I usually sit at the bar and there's no issues with lines.  Wish we had one of these in the bay area.

kCZ6hwmYE0qN2HLCZJtkHw.text: I finally made it. I have been to exclusive London clubs, I have been to expensive London restaurants, but I have never felt a place to be so close and yet so far away from me. The monstrous waiting times (my first attempt at going was cut short when the lady at the door told us we'd have to go back 3 hours later - and that was at 8pm) and the fact that I have a full-time job meant that I would probably have to wait for weeks, maybe months, until I'd make it.Patience is a great virtue though, and so is willpower. Armed with these, and a good friend, we went, we put our names down, and headed to the pub. We were told we'd have to wait for at least an hour, so after two hours and two glasses of wine had passed without receiving the telephone call we were so desperate to get, we took our chances and headed over. Luckily, our table was just getting prepared for us, so we sat down straight away. There is no food menu; just one for drinks, with a good selection of cocktails, spirits and beers, and a rather limited selection of wines. I was a bit disappointed with the small choice we were given for wine, especially given Goodman's amazing wine list. You can only famously get 3 things once you're in - burger, lobster or lobster roll. We went for a lobster roll and cheeseburger, split in half. They were great. Good food makes me happy. I was happy once I started eating. The food also arrived very quickly, which kind of made up for the two hours wait. The burger was fantastic, although my bun was a little bit crunchy and I would have preferred it softer. The lobster roll was delicious and highly recommended. Looking back, I'd say go for the lobster or lobster roll. They feel a little bit more 'special', plus you can get good burgers in many places around London, with about a quarter of the waiting time.I really, really wish I could have given this place 5 stars. I WANTED to give this place 5 stars. However, despite the food (and atmosphere) being fantastic, waiting for two hours when we were diplomatically told 'at least one' was a bit frustrating. What was more frustrating, however, was that despite the service being excellent and our waitress being very friendly, we got the feeling we had to get the hell out of there as soon as we finished our meals or else we'd be getting kicked out. Pushy yet polite, our waitress gave us the dessert options and when we said we didn't want any she brought us the bill because our table was about to be given away. This meant we spent two hours waiting for one hour of dining, which was not disastrous but it made the experience feel a little bit less special, which is a shame. Was it worth the wait though? Definitely? Would I go again? Of course, but I'd give it another week. I need to hit the gym now.

d9daMnRwcNOip_8m2Qfl_Q.text: The food was good but the staff could not be more rude, especially the hostess and the staff behind the bar. When we arrived there were no tables. We were told it would be a half hour wait for a table. So we said we were willing to sit at the bar. When a table opened up 5 minutes later we asked if we could move to it (there was no one else waiting for a table). After a lot of huffing and eye rolling from the hostess, she finally let us move. We had small children with us, so why she was so shocked we would rather sit at a table rather than the bar was strange. We especially wanted to move from the bar after the staff behind the bar ignored us at first, then got irritated that we asked for a menu (not knowing they didn't have one), only to have them chastise us for our drink order. This place is just not worth the bother.

X5tENxvCkYdPSmdl6NZ55Q.text: Nice concept. We arrived before six, so we were seated immediately. But it did start to fill up quite quickly so the no reservations policy might be quite irritating for later diners (especially considering the location i.e. quite dead).My dining partner and i both opted for the lobster roll. The Three dishes (whole lobster, burger or lobster roll) are all accompanied by fries and salad for £20. The cocktail was weak. The fries had a human hair in them (not good). We did not bring this to their attention though.The salad was missing lettuce. I do feel that certain salad leaves are very strong tasting and need the plain crispness of lettuce to mellow.The melted butter boat accompanying the lobster roll was very generous so be careful if pouring! I suggest you dip the roll in it rather than pour- better for the waist line and the heart i imagine!Only two mousses for dessert: the choc coffee and the lime. Both served in a small cardboard container. Both quite lovely.All in all, if its lobster you want, this is the place to go.We have decided to visit again to try the burger. All ten ounces of it! Will add that experience to my reviews.

WQTp8w3cd2Q3XhDF7d6JtA.text: Burger and Lobster in Mayfair is truly a unique and tasty experience. Opened in the latter half of 2011 by Goodman, this restaurant has already had a big impact in the capital. As the name suggests, there is no menu but the choice of Burger or Lobster. To be more precise you can chose between a whole grilled or steamed Canadian Lobster (I recommend having it grilled), a Lobster Roll or a Burger with all the trimmings, each priced at £20. There are some great sides included, some lovely extra crispy french fries and yummy garlic and herb butter to dip your crustacean in. The side salad was ok, though a little drowned in dressing which made it a little soggy. There are also some impressive cocktails to keep you occupied while you wait for your food to arrive, they are quite pricey at £9 but they are of top quality and go down very well. If you are hoping to have dinner at The Burger and Lobster, I recommend you head down there before 6pm if you can, to guarantee a table. They do not except reservations and I have known of people waiting for over two hours for a table. Having said this, the staff are charming and if you only go once to this unusual place, you will find the food and atmosphere something you may never experience anywhere else in London and all for only £20! itsnosmallthing.weebly.c…

ZFozYpxOO1U1DVJjarorlg.text: Awesome little spot! Only has two main dishes a burger or a lobster. The lobter of my choice 900g with the lemon garlic butter, make that 2 lemon and garlic butters. I ate at the bar rather than wait for a table and got to people watch all the beautiful people coming and going!!

PeDRwjYfs2nXPhXMyu30QA.text: It's hard to express in words my excitement when first hearing about this place. I like burgers. I like lobster. Imagine a place that is a combination of both of these wonderful things and it's by the people behind Goodman, people who really know about burgers. As it happens I was ill on the opening day and had to wait to indulge myself. Luckily with the Monday off from work I set out in the downpour, not letting anything stand in my way of stuffing that lobster down my throat. A short walk from Green Park station the sign is quite low key and could possibly be missed if you were casually passing by. Inside the first thing you see is the lack of the 600 litre tank, the largest lobster tank in Europe apparently. If you're really curious then ask the staff and they will show you the vats which are a lot less impressive than you would imagine and btw, no, you can't point out which lobster you want for your meal. On to the menu. There are two things you can have, burger or lobster. Yes, that's it. But that's plenty. The options are all £20 each and now you might be wondering why a burger here is more than a burger at any of the Goodman branches? The answer is that it is bigger. Then there is the lobster, which comes as a whole lobster  grilled or steamed  or as a roll. Having heard good things about the roll and convincing myself that no matter how much I wanted there was no way I could fit both burger and lobster that day I went with the roll. When it arrived I initially regretted my choice. Instead of a massive burger or a whole lobster there was this tiny little roll in front of me  the looks were deceiving though, I was pretty full afterwards. My first bite into the roll made me wish I could have more than one roll. It was incredibly tasty. The lobster married perfectly with that pillowy, sweet brioche bun. In short, £20 for lobster is a great deal and Burger&Lobster really know how to cook them. Go now before they raise their price.

o3BkP4283sz9irPSgfpA-A.text: This is my favourite restaurant in London and I live in Marylebone so spoilt for choice.Tried the 8lb 10oz monster and lost but had the luxury of grabbing a doggy bag and eating it for breakfast.Been in for drinks also and have had excellent service at the bar. I think I need to move to Mayfair and make it my local

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. River Monster

NUKTmtAfc3iH-tKG623y6w.text: If I could give this zero I would! I live abroad now and wanted to meet up with a friend from school at this restaraunt. From 45 minutes of sitting down and eating they were trying to kick us out. The stages are listed below1. Constantly coming and checking our plates, then picking up anything that looked empty.2. The manager hovering past every 10 minutes and glancing at us3. This then gratuated to bringing the people our table was meant for after us, to our table, and letting them enjoy the show of us eating our meal. When I say bringing them to our table, I mean they were literally leaning on it!4. Then the manager passed by for a final time and said whilst glaring at us "I dont know they were supposed to be out of here half an hour ago!"5. And then finally serving us with a 10 pound service charge,  for being rushed and intimidated into leaving! I've been to higher end restaraunts than this and would gladly pay that, if it was deserved. I suggest you go to the soho one, this place is a disgrace,  I was expecting to sit down, enjoy my meal and catch up with my friend who I havent seen in years, friday night or not. I am after all paying for it, you get better service at kfc!

3siUtYThJ9Ya4O8tUd1tyw.text: Fantastic Mate! The food is so good. I ordered the lobster roll and hamburger. My son ordered an entire lobster. We ended up sharing the food and I must say, it was delicious! Love the garlic butter too!

ZON_uivBf8I25WSv9kEq9g.text: So disappointing....we waited almost 50 min for a table- I had the burger, he had the lobster roll - both average. £20 for each was too much, I've had a better burger at a near by local pub. Place is a douchy bro spot - 5 drunk frat boys who interrupted the couple next to us during their dinner, wanker manager didn't do anything and left to poor waitress to escort out. You come here to be seen, not for the food or service. Not sure what the fuzz is about - too many other great food places!

h-36A9Hrbwl3k20y8iGIuA.text: An unexpected disappointment. My wife and two adult children were really looking forward to our meal here on March 23rd. That's because a previous visit to another in London had been simply excellent. However we arrived and were told we would have to wait for about 45 minutes. That was ok with us despite it being a bit late because we were anxious to eat another great burger. An hour passed, then an hour and a half and despite numerous checks with the hostess we kept being told it would just be a few minutes. We finally got a table after about an hour and forty minutes!!Then the burger. Great anticipation. Great disappointment in that it was overcooked and dry despite our desire for medium (the same way we had ordered it on a previous visit). Not sure what the problems are with this location but would never return. A truly bad experience all around!

802bbdEywTnDiBVjOQTVlw.text: Amazing burger! Great service. Yes, the menu is simple but that's how I like it. In the mood for a burger or lobster? This is the place!

3jh8Kb5cYRzDOOKYtPiUhA.text: They don't take reservations, so get there early, if you don't want to wait.  They have... Burger's & Lobster's.  GREAT Burger's & Lobster's.  I had an awesome Grilled Lobster and she had a delicious Lobster Roll.  Friendly service.  Very casual.  It's really a must try.  I can't wait til the Manhattan location opens up this fall.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Lobster Roll
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Awesome Grilled Lobster

tEuE59hHPSFAp2wBFwWL0Q.text: It's no surprise that everyone in London wants to give this place a try - I don't know of any other restaurant that will serve you a whole lobster of £20! Went on a Monday night at 630pm and had no issues getting a table. They don't seat you until the entire party arrives so it's not exactly group friendly. I liked how the booze menu was separated into burger and lobster - nice touch! Service was a bit spotty I have to say, but mostly fine.Word of advice, it's not a place to go for a first date if you're planning on eating the whole lobster. I asked for mine to be steamed instead of grilled just because I find the lobster tends to be juicier! Once the monster-sized lobster arrived, the bib and handwipes came in handy because I kept getting lobster shells/juice/meat everywhere...not very attractive! It's so much fun to be able to pick the meat yourself - for those who would rather not deal with the mess, go for the lobster roll (marinated with a mayonnaise-ish sauce and served in a hot-dog brioche bun). The table beside us had the burger - looked the same in shape, size as the one at Goodman's (both places are owned by the same people). Just head to Maddox St, not worth paying an extra £7 for the same thing.Although I ate as fast as I could mostly because I felt bad with the number of people waiting at the bar, it was still a 2 hour dinner which could be why it takes so long to get a table. Go early, otherwise the chances of getting a table are slim - unless you don't mind eating at 1030pm just before closing!I would give it 5 stars...but the spotty service + oversalted and nearly inedible chips let the place down. It's worth going, but I definitely wouldn't wait for 3 hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

RTDcHr5HzR6w_Xj_AjF2nQ.text: Great food, great service but very crowded all the time. Expect a wait during rush time.

m_iPXp77FwIddKAxOBkUCA.text: My feelings are very mixed on Burger and Lobster, on the one hand it is usually a very enjoyable meal with a good atmosphere but on the other hand a burger or lobster roll is over priced at £20. Long queues to get a table can also be frustrating.A good venue for a group but often long waits for table don't make it an ideal place to meet (bookings are only taken for groups of 6-10). I still can't decide where I stand, so you'll just have to go and try it at least the once to make up your own minds.

EanfOzquJ9S1JYRxUyAiMQ.text: It serves lobster and burger only. No menu. Cosy environment and delicious food, but quit expensive...

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom

dC7qMc0bXgUZUQq2IEDyYg.text: well .... where do i start? .... DELICIOUS !! SCRUMPTIOUS!! MOUTH WATERING!!! ... Burger &Lobster is usually a busy place so we had to wait to be seated but dammit its totally worth it! ordered the whole lobster (grilled) with the butter and lemon sauce ... oh ... my .... sweet baby Jesus!! it was so damn delicious I was almost crying when the meal came to a premature ending!! I also had a grapefruit soda which was lovely!!! it wasnt as sweet as I liked so they gave me extra syrup ... basically the staff are great and the food is even better!! get there like NOW!!!!!!!! and maybe take me too ;)

MJbIdyCzWysw3TX2tfVaiA.text: Absolutely love this place. There can be long queues, especially at popular dinner and lunch times, but totally worth it. I've tried both the burger and lobster roll, and have never been disappointed. The lobster roll is packed with lobster meat and served on a delicious buttered brioche roll (yes, that bun alone might be a heart attack, but lipsmacking good i say!). The burger almost seems expensive at 20 pounds compared to the lobster and lobster roll, which are all offered at the same price, but definitely one of the great burgers of London.This restaurant has been expanding around London, but I've only been to the Mayfair and Soho locations which are very different in terms of ambience (same amazing level of food). The Mayfair location is smaller and feels more intimate while the Soho location has more tables and feels more modern. These locations have different perks but you really can't go wrong when burger or lobster is involved!

TCW4xwUXMYqpRYUVlR6JUQ.text: Been meaning to come here for a long time, especially given how close it is to my offices in Berkeley Square. Finally got around to it today. I arrived expecting to wait for an hour, but the wait on a Sunday at around 1230 is closer to thirty minutes. Not too bad. There were bar seats that were immediately available though. We decided to go halves on the burger and the lobster roll. I quenched mine with a gin, Earl Grey, watermelon juice iced tea, which was quite refreshing. Let's start off with the burger:The bun was not of the buttery brioche type variety, but was very clean, and good. The ratio of meat to bun was perfect, well balanced, very much like what you'd get at Patty and Bun or Meat Liquor. We ordered our patties medium rare, and they were delivered perfectly cooked, with a nice amount of pink in the centre of the patty. On a subsequent trip, the patty was over-done, so don't hesitate to send yours back if not cooked to perfection. You are paying 20£ for the burger, after all.As I took a ginormous bite out of it, the juiciness of the burger exploded in my mouth, and all the ingredients came together. Perfect. The lobster roll for me is the star of the show... it's so hard to find a decent lobster roll in this city, and this one if pretty f-ing decent. Not too much butter, the taste of the lobster comes through, and it's pretty loaded up. I kinda didn't want to share it.All in a all a great place, pricey, but definitely on my 'take people to' list in London.Go there.But bear in mind: the burgers are better in my mind at Patty and Bun or even Meat Liquor. But the lobsters... my goodness!

o0mK5Z6Ws7YcSzJsZS-3xQ.text: Sat at the bar, shared the lobster roll, was fabulous. Dipping the bread in the melted butter or pouring it over the top, either way it was delicious. As other reviewers have mentioned the place is very busy. We found a seat at the bar right away and were served quickly. Drinks were just okay. This would of been 5 stars but the drink selection wasn't that great.

VduJm0BwSNfmlJESlOuwKg.text: Just a block from my flat, this place is SUPER DANGEROUS. Ok, I'll admit it, I am an American and my parents both were raised on the East Coast with all of the lobster. But all that really means is that I have very high standards for my lobster and burgers.Went for my first time tonight and I'm hooked. Yes, you will have to queue (I'm trying to use my British as much as possible!) if you are a bigger party, but the best kept secret is the bar seating with a full menu (all 3 options!). There was pretty consistently 2-3 seats together opening up, so if you don't mind sitting with other people that's your free pass on the wait.Had the lobster roll and it was terrific. The bread was well toasted with just the right amount of butter. The lobster was great, simple, light mayonaise only (I always order without onions) and the lobster was fresh with just the right amount of firmness.Add on-top some great chat with the staff behind the bar, this is a winning (but yes, pricey) spot and I fear it may become a regular spot for me.

b-soV8p2NQa4R0L4dIn0gw.text: Big chunks of lobster, gorgeous roll. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. So damn good. The fries too.

q0yJbRscmXEzm4ob-nmfIQ.text: I was in London for a day and decided to eat here. I ate the burger and Lobster coincidentally and was not disappointed. the lobster roll is delicious with a burger and fries on the side. sounds like a lot of food but I was able to eat it all. and took some lobster off my girlfriends plate as well :)

j1WnzoyRaXFB3x0y7wDe4A.text: Finally on saturday I managed to visit this place for dinner. I have tried many times since is next door to my place, but never succeeded in getting a place on the list for dinner time. The place is cosy, not huge but not claustrophobic and noisy as other central places. The staff is very friendly and nice.They only serve 3 dishes as the name suggests: burger, lobster grilled or steamed and the lobster roll. All is served with french fries and salad. I went for the lobster roll, which was a sort of savoury brioche filled with delicious chopped lobster meat: great. The drinks list is also nice, with a lot of original cocktails designed to be served with each one of the available dishes. I took a beer, but my friends tries some lobster cocktails and they looked very good. The food is good and the price is very cheap (we paid £22.5 each), the only problem with this place is that they don't take reservations and the list for tables is always very long (at 8 there were 2.5 hours waiting time). Also, once you are in, they don't urge you to leave after dinner, so the people in the queue do not really have a sense of when they will be seated.

XIJQndDNjxefS64pca2I6A.text: Awesome burger, chips don't match-up though - they should improve on these.  Place kinda suck so I took it home for a much better ambience.  Wish they find a way to pack desserts for take out too.  Nice/friendly staff.

o4FpqrPTwQ8waE5s6IzKfg.text: We heard that the wait would be 1-2 hours and were expecting to grab a coffee, but when we arrived, they asked if we minded sitting at the bar and we were seated almost immediately. This was lunchtime on a Saturday.The food is great. It's hard to go wrong with grilled whole lobsters (slight smokey flavour on the outside and perfectly cooked meat with a bit of bite!), with garlic butter and really crispy fries that are soft on the inside. The service is pretty quick, and given the amount of people waiting, they are very patient and don't mind you hanging around a bit after your meal to finish your conversation. It's very comfortable and not pretentious at all. £20 for a good, filling meal in a relaxed setting, lives up to the hype. I've been there twice now, planning my third trip soon!

aBlC-SbA3-0LjJf-C_lXKQ.text: Is it worth it? The answer is yes. Great vibe, the place is buzzing and food is fantastic. I loved the lobster roll, only comment is the brioche could be slightly less buttery, other than that perfection and lots of it. Chips were great, not too salty, add your own. Enjoyed the salad, party on. Cannot bring myself to give 5 stars, it's not a hidden gem. Would I come back? Maybe not. Would I bring a guest back, definitely. Would I ever be tempted to order the burger? Hell no !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The table next to us. They look a little miserable. Not have their food yet, I guess !
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. There she is !
Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Place is jumping !

fLa5_z2V5Lp05dVpVBkSHQ.text: Delicious lobster roll and burger.  Three items Burger, Lobster and Lobster roll. All come with chips and salad and all are £20.

09YUvreb1PSm17lNlOFS-A.text: Great location in SohoCocktails are great and above standard in restaurantGood to have only 3 options at the same price.If you're 2 and want to share they will slice it for youOnly downside is that it is very noisy so difficult to have a conversation

1aEJOW6YVsdjQmLzOrTXvw.text: Great food and prompt service! The 2 lb. Lobster was nothing less than decitant. Our kids loved the burgers . Jamie was our waiter and he was perfection!

458UlExdI31hqbsUxL8AHQ.text: After waiting 30 minutes, we came back to check our status and were told we'd be seated next.  We watched as 3 groups after us got seated...so we ask again and were told those groups were able to be seated at the bar.  Seats at the bar were never offered to us and when we told them we didn't know it was an option, they continued to have us wait another 10 minutes.  40+ minutes from our initial arrival, we were finally being seated...& to save time, we told our server we were ready to order as they sat us...another fives minutes before someone comes to take our order.  £ 60 later...not worth it.

OF1t_HI0_EHBEKpKqG8pCQ.text: Good lobster sandwich + fries + salad for £20. Should give it a try if you're never been in one of these nice lobster oriented restaurants! You can also decide to get a normal lobster, grilled or steamed, + fries + salad = £20.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Lobster sandwich + fries + salad = 20

YFeLBd-NXSvklmT9_jM0qg.text: Um this place is amazing!!!! They only have 3 items to choose from for 20£ but you won't be disappointed! We're always so grateful to find these hidden gems off the beaten path.. Thank god for Yelp! It's come through on several occasions. The staff here is really good!

o439SX6hCY9L9MHJCrA4pQ.text: Second time at this restaurant, but a different location. Food, drinks and service still the same: great. There are times when things would be different with the same restaurant chain, but it's not the case with them. They definitely had it down. We would come back again and again when we are in the London area. Thanks again for the pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Grilled Lobster

KRQTDghQRoJGORiylyWyIQ.text: Went there with few friends after work and although we had to wait for the table it was well worth it. The staff made us very welcome from the start and the food was delicious.

IUSg43MwnLOERdHYZDCmWQ.text: If you want a fantastic burger or lobster, this is the place to go.   Relaxed atmosphere, very nice staff, quick service and awesome food.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. The lobster roll and burger, delucious!

Z8-6eMGE9oMtWwPzRdfQRA.text: I love it when a restaurant lives up to the hype.  Yes, the wait was a bit longer than we'd like but always a plus if you like to drink and can squat at a pub for a few hours before.  I went with 3 other Americans and we ended up ordering 6 mains for the 4 of us... so we can each get half of all 3 items.  If we waited this long, we might as well get the full experience!  Here's how I'd rate them1) Lobster - Definitely my favorite of the 3.  It was fresh, perfectly cooked and comes with this amazing garlic butter that's really good dipping your fries in (and a friend slathered a bit on his burger!).2) Lobster roll - Yes, it is small but so tasty!  If that was the only thing I was having, I wish it was bigger but that night glad it wasn't.3) Burger - It was a really delicious (and HUGE) burger.  But I think for 20 quid, I'd probably stick to the lobster when I go back.  Oh and the fries - how do they make it so good?

AnPAdJKCw_xOBurWYHM0Fw.text: Tried this specialty restaurant in London.  Only three items on the menu... All £20 each.I tried the hamburger, medium rare. It was by far, the absolute best burger I have had in years!! The meat was delicious, but most impressive was how perfectly cooked it was.Recommend 100%....

7Pyw6POAUd78jn_ltBY3iw.text: Absolutely amazing. We are from Dallas. Husband was craving a burger and I would never turn down a  lobster roll! Even the side salad was delish! Great find!

i0li7u-pFOnUDZb6NHfZXw.text: Good burgersUHMAZING picklesgood saladUHMAZING chips/fries/frittesThe bar is stocked with really top shelf booze. The cocktails are greatBeer selection is teenyI arrived with a fellow Yelper Tirth who's name is too hard to pronounce and began calling him Timbuktu. That's neither here nor here. We were told it would be an hour wait for lunch on a saturday at 1pm, so we headed to the bar only to find a place for us. YAY! There are only 3 items on the menu, and I saw no one with a lobster roll on their table, so I went with the burger like the other 2 blokes I was with. I ordered mine Medium well and it was still really pink in the centre, not quite what I'm used to coming from the states, but it was OK. The burger had as smoky flavour and I'm not a fan of smoke. So it was OK, and I'm sure by gourmet standards it was divine. I am not a fan of making a burger gourmet.... its a BURGER, street food. I think it should be kept that way.   The pickles were the best part. Seriously, it was sweet and spicy and vinegary. Great. The fries were equally tasty and free-flowing (FREE REFILLS). Collectively we had about 5 orders of fries. over all.... good. but I would go again for the lobster roll and cocktails.

PllkcyCN0GEf_yAvIoC1Hw.text: Love this place. Very popular with tourist as its highly reviewed,but quality has been maintained. Had lobster plate with garlic butter, fries and salad. Each component is well executed. Lobsters are from maine. Steamed then finished on the grill giving that extra oomph. Fries stayed crispy throughout. Salad perfectly dressed. Beer is good. Even the cappuccino is wonderful.Service is excellent and staff is very friendly. Strongly recommend.

DrWj8z7wBKVTaUZ2RAeGLA.text: There's not a lot I can add that hasn't already been said - except perhaps that if long wait times aren't your thing, Monday nights are the way to go. We walked in at 7pm and got a table pretty much straight away. I even overheard the maitre d' comment that on a Monday night, people tend to get in and out with lingering - so even if there is a wait, it doesn't tend to be as long. All that said, I've now been to Burger and Lobster three times and had all three things on the menu. (I've also managed to have the lobster roll at each sitting. It's THAT good). Lobster is definitely the main game here. A whole lobster for £20 is definitely tempting, but can I just mention again the lobster roll.... (can't decide? Get both - I do!)I'm a burger junkie, so I have broken into nervous sweats each time I skip past the burger here. I have now tried it and can confirm the burger is excellent - however it isn't really worth £20 (I wonder if that's what helps keeps the lobster prices so reasonable?). My tip - if it's just the burger you want, go to Goodman's Steak Restaurant (Burger and Lobster is a Goodman's venture). It's practically the same excellent burger at £14. Oh, and they take reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. My kind of menu!

KV8IGC-nxzBS4ARjgIQZ2A.text: London's hottest restaurant serves just 3 items...lobster, lobster roll, and burger. But oh does it do those 3 things to perfection.The burger (with crispy bacon of course) was exceptional and came with a side of chips and a small mixed salad. A bit pricey at 20 pounds considering that also gets you a whole lobster, but I'd definitely get the burger again. My friend literally was drooling over his lobster roll which comes with it own gravy boat of melted butter. A perfect last meal before starting that low-cholesterol diet!Crowd was upscale though rather intoxicated/rowdy...clearly folks are drinking heavily while they wait 1-2 hours for a table. Which to be honest almost had me mark Burger & Lobster down a star---the adjacent table was too drunk too obnoxious, I felt bad for the waitress. In the end the food wins out.Burger & Lobster takes no reservations so get there early or be prepared to wait and wait and wait and wait and wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Burger & Lobster - London, United Kingdom. Burger

d2OkZt6aViU9iAg750_9iQ.text: Not much needs to be said. I've been to virtually every branch and this is as consistent as the rest. Service, food and atmosphere spot on. I have never got the burger and I never will as the Lobster is far to good a deal. The Lobster is just a dream of meal. I actually prefer it to the whole Lobster just cos it's so perfectly formed and less messy.

7BxK9VokkTMULDkF_dvYvw.text: Never had the burger but the lobster and lobster roll are delicious! Chips are great as well, noticeably good actually (i don't usually notice chips!). Not inexpensive, you don't get much lobster roll for £20 even if it is good!Had one incident with a staff member when they were less than friendly but aside from that all good. The queue is the thing that gets me though. You can't book so you either have to eat super early or wait in the queue for ages. What I have been able to do is hold a place in the queue with the person on the door and go for a drink nearby and they call you when your table is ready!Definitely a place to try, might be a one night only thing but worth a look.
